intro: Aeschynomene kassneri, commonly known as the smallleaf aeschynomene, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect growth habit. The plant features trifoliate leaves and produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in semi-arid environments. Aeschynomene kassneri is also noted for its potential in forage and soil stabilization due to its nitrogen-fixing ability.
